summary: This document is an email chain from December 2019 between Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and attorneys Brendan Quigley and Andrew Lankier, who represent an individual (likely a pilot or staff member) subpoenaed in the Epstein investigation. The prosecutors are following up on the production of documents, specifically flight manifests and travel records from 2000 onward, and seek information about observations of young women/girls on flights and Epstein's employees.

persons.name: Brendan Quigley
persons.context: Attorney representing an individual (likely a pilot or staff member) who received a grand jury subpoena in the Epstein investigation. He is coordinating with prosecutors regarding document production and scheduling calls.

persons.name: Andrew Lankier
persons.context: Attorney, alongside Brendan Quigley, representing the subpoenaed individual. Referred to as 'Andy' in emails, he is involved in communications with the prosecution team about the subpoena response.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the Southern District of New York, leading the correspondence to follow up on the subpoena for flight records and information related to Jeffrey Epstein. She signs off on key emails outlining the investigation's requests.

connections.description: Co-counsel representing the same client (a subpoenaed individual) in the Epstein investigation, coordinating responses to prosecutors.
Prosecutor communicating with defense attorney regarding compliance with a grand jury subpoena for documents and information.
Prosecutor corresponding with defense attorney about the status of subpoenaed records and scheduling discussions.

events.title: Original Subpoena Return Date
events.description: Initial return date for a grand jury subpoena issued to an individual (likely a pilot or staff member) in the Epstein investigation, which prosecutors agreed to hold in abeyance for discussions.

events.title: Planned Initial Document Production
events.description: Prosecutors note they are planning to receive an initial production of documents from the defense, with more to follow after the holidays, regarding the Epstein subpoena.

keyFacts: Prosecutors sought flight manifests, flight plans, and travel records dating back to 2000 from a subpoenaed individual connected to Epstein.

The investigation specifically requested information about observations of young women or girls on flights and any discussions with Epstein about his relationships with young women/girls or related legal issues.
Prosecutors also sought the identities of Epstein's employees and staff, both current and previous, from the subpoenaed individual.
The email chain reveals ongoing negotiations and delays in document production, with the defense attorneys coordinating call schedules and production timelines with the U.S. Attorney's office.
